app.internal package¶

Submodules¶

app.internal.convert module¶

ConverModuel

app.internal.convert.convert(list: list[float] | list[int]) → list[str]¶

takes in a list of numbers and returns a list of strings of each number

Args:

list (list): list of numbers

Returns:

list[str]: list of strings of the original numbers

app.internal.format_number module¶

FormatNumberModuel

app.internal.format_number.format_number(number: int) → str¶

Returns a

Side note: to do it this way: return “{:,}”.format(number) felt like cheating.

Args:

number: must be integer

Returns:

string of number with dot at each 10^3 position

app.internal.mid module¶

MidModuel

app.internal.mid.mid(string: str) → str¶

Returns the middle letter of a string.

Args:

string (str): string to find the middle letter of

Returns:

str: middle letter if odd and the empty string if even

app.internal.only_ints module¶

OnlyIntsModuel

app.internal.only_ints.only_ints(num1: int | float, num2: int | float) → bool¶

Takes in two numbers. If they are both integers return true else false.

Args:

num1 (int): num2 (int):

Returns:

bool: True if num1 and num2 are integers False otherwise

app.internal.zap module¶

ZapModuel

app.internal.zap.zap(list1: list, list2: list) → list[tuple]¶

Returns a list of tuples consiting of the elements of the two input lists

Args:

list1 (list): list of any values list2 (list): list of any values

Returns:

list[tuple]: list of tuples
